thread.title: Gov. Brown signs bill closing loophole on ivory sales
thread.title_full: Gov. Brown signs bill closing loophole on ivory sales - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Carolyne Zinko
title: Gov. Brown signs bill closing loophole on ivory sales
text:
Photo: Brandon Chew, The Chronicle People pass by a mammoth ivory tusk in the window of Rare Art & Antiques store in San Francisco China Town in California, on Tuesday, July 28, 2015. People pass by a mammoth ivory tusk in the window of Rare Art &...
One of the nation’s largest markets for elephant ivory should become one of its smallest next year, after Gov. Jerry Brown’s signature Sunday on a bill banning the sale and purchase of such ivory in California, among other legislation. People pass by a mammoth ivory tusk in the window of Rare Art & Antiques store in San Francisco China Town in California, on Tuesday, July 28, 2015. People pass by a mammoth ivory tusk in the window of Rare Art &...
One of the nation’s largest markets for elephant ivory should become one of its smallest next year, after Gov. Jerry Brown’s signature Sunday on a bill banning the sale and purchase of such ivory in California, among other legislation.
